content: On October 22, 1995, the Atlanta Braves clinched their first World Series title since relocating from Milwaukee, defeating the Cleveland Indians in Game 6 of the Fall Classic. Tom Glavine delivered a masterful performance, pitching eight scoreless innings and allowing only one hit, while the Braves' offense backed him with a decisive 1-0 victory. This triumph marked a historic moment for the franchise, solidifying their status as a dominant force in Major League Baseball during the 1990s.
